text: Bottle - Creamy and yeasty notes. Clear. Very light and creamy bready notes. Super easy drinking.

Sampled at a sushi joint in Kabukicho, Tokyo. Crystal clear pour could be mistaken for water. Served chilled, but the alcohol vapors still were evident on the nose. Flavor a bit rough around the edges, but was still enjoyable notes of pear and apple and maybe a kiss of honey. Not my favorite sake, but still quite palatable. At a reasonably priced $8/bottle, it gets an extra point for value.

From an izakaya in Gakugei-Daigaku. Very floral and perfume-like aromas of rice and flower with some fruit on the nose as well. Crystal clear (like water) pour. Taste is more of the same but sweet. Texture is slightly grainy but mostly clean. Sweet warming finish.

Sampled as part of a Sake flight at Sakagura with Linh and Zahra. Pours a clear body. Aroma is strong alcohol and faint fruits. Mouthfeel is medium to thick with notes of fruit, peach, strawberries, melon and soft gentle alcohol character.

Bottle, 09/19/2013. Pours clear, slight silvery sheen. Aroma is pear, watermelon, light honeysuckle, full sweet rice finish. Taste is honeyed toasted rice, slight nuttiness, booze is a bit harsh at first. Medium body, hot. Decent, but not overly complex.

clear as water, nice leg formation. Nose is floral perfume, very soft. Flavor is light rice, floral, bit of stinging ethanol through finish, lingering warmth in incredibly short finish, very soft with citrus upon warmth.

Bottle shared by MrChopin.  Pours very clear.  Aroma is sweet rice, spicy alcohol, and fruit notes of pear and faint banana.  Flavor is sweet rice, fruits and spicy alcohol.  Medium body, high warmth and no carbonation.

750mL thanks to MrChopin's sister. Clear water pour with decent, thick legs. Nose is rich tropical vodka with rich cherries and pineapple. Very beautiful nose. Taste is very clean and neutral with no alcohol presence. It evaporates on the tongue instantly. Small spicy alcohol. Very clean. I like this. Not stickiness Or alcohol overpowering. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A Mes rate. Bottle thanks to Craig, via Chris.Throughly inoffensive but really standard. Pretty much no different to any other sake you could drink after a Chinese meal. Nice and fruity, lightly sweet and floral and a little raw. Standard.

Bottle 300ml.Clear cristal clear color with virtually none head. Aroma is moderate rice, moderate to light heavy spicy - anis. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, sharp, alcohol burnig finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is flat, finish feel is light to moderate alcoholic. [20100523]

bottle at chris -o ... nice clear ... licorice and light rice ... soft ... big alcohol front ... little rough ... and again licorice ...little sharp ... 
heated ... alcohol kicked up in the nose ... bit more rice ... and aniseed seems a little broader
Soy sauce and plum/melon aroma.   Clear water appearance with just a tint of yellow.  Initial flavor a light melon followed by a dry soy sauce flavor.  Tasty and quite enjoyable.

This is your textbook Honjozo Sake. 
Hakkaisan sakes are always clean and crisp.  Very Niigata, very good. 
The slight fortification brings out great balance in this well crafted sake.
Transperant. Plummy aromas. Smooth and fruity without too much complexity. Still some yeastiness and noticeable alcohol. Light-bodied and grainy texture. Enjoyable.
